author: brane
msg: More work on issue #872. We weren't calling diff correctly.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c (diff_file_changed): Print the file
index line in the native encoding.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c (svn_io_run_cmd): *Do* pass program args
to APR in the APR encoding, not the native one.
(svn_io_run_diff, svn_io_run_diff3): Pass UTF-8 program names to
svn_io_run_cmd and svn_error_createf.

author: fitz
msg: Fix typo.
* /trunk/doc/book/book/ch06.xml: Fix typo.

author: fitz
msg: Changes from the meeting on Sunday.  Stopped at svn export.
* /trunk/doc/book/book/ch08.xml: Incorporate edits from review.

author: epg
msg: Fix issue #1099: Hook ra_svn up with checksumming action.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/client.c: Include <apr_md5.h> and "svn_md5.h".
(ra_svn_get_file): Read a checksum from the get-file response.
Calculate a checksum as the file is read, and compare it to the
provided checksum.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/editor.c: Include <apr_md5.h> and "svn_md5.h".
(ra_svn_svndiff_close): Read a command response in order to catch
errors decoding the svndiff (this is where any checksum errors
found by the receiver will be reported).
(ra_svn_apply_textdelta): Send base_checksum and result_checksum
along with the token in the apply-textdelta command (turning NULL
pointers into "").
(ra_svn_handle_apply_textdelta): Read base_checksum and
result_checksum from the sender (turning "" into NULL pointers),
and pass them along to apply_textdelta.  Wrap the svn_stream_close
call with SVN_CMD_ERR so checksum errors will be reported to the
sender, otherwise send an empty command response so the sender
knows it succeeded.
* subversion/svnserve/serve.c: Include <apr_md5.h> and "svn_md5.h".
(get_file): Get the checksum for the file and send it in the
get-file response.

author: brane
msg: Fixed issue #872. Final correctness and readability changes.
* subversion/libsvn_fs/fs.c (svn_fs_create_berkeley): Call APR with APR-encoded
paths, but call Berkeley DB with native paths.
(svn_fs_open_berkeley, svn_fs_berkeley_recover, svn_fs_berkeley_recover):
Move the UTF-8-to-native conversion to just before the BDB call for clarity.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/opt.c (svn_opt_args_to_target_array): Always maintain
the master target array in UTF-8, converting to and from APR encoding only
before the call to apr_filepath_merge.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/util.c (svn_cl__edit_externally): Use APR-encoded
paths to call APR, but call system() with a native-encoded path.
(svn_cl__cleanup_log_msg): Send UTF-8 encoded path to svn_error_createf.
* subversion/svnserve/serve.c (find_repos): Use APR-encoded paths to call
APR, and canonocalize the UTF-8, not the APR-encoded path.
